app_subtitle: Generate shell scripts for downloading YouTube audiobooks with yt-dlp
introduction_paragraph_1: Downloading audiobooks from YouTube and adding metadata like title, author, chapters, and cover art takes time. This browser-based tool prepares a list of YouTube video links and book details, then generates a script that handles everything automatically.
introduction_paragraph_2: For each video link, you enter book information: title, author, narrator, series, and year. The app generates a script that uses {ytdlp} to {downloadAudio}. Then {ffmpeg} embeds the metadata, adds chapter markers (if available), and incorporates cover art into the audio files.
introduction_download_audio: download the video and extract the audio
introduction_paragraph_3: Everything runs in your browser - your data stays on your computer. Run the generated script in your terminal to download and process the audiobooks.
book_card_book_title_helper: Example: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
book_card_narrator_helper: Person who reads the audiobook (e.g., Jim Dale)
book_card_series_helper: Name of the book series (e.g., Harry Potter)
metadata_dialog_description: The fetched metadata differs from your current data. Please select which values to keep:
settings_cookies_browser_helper: Attach cookies from your browser to bypass 403 errors and access non-public videos.
script_generation_warning_text: You need to have {ytdlpLink} and {ffmpegLink} need to be installed in order for the script to work.
script_generation_error_no_books: Please add at least one book with URL, title, author, and narrator.
script_generation_error_copy_failed: Failed to copy to clipboard. Please try again.
csv_dialog_description: Select a CSV file to import. Make sure the columns match the expected format: YouTube URL, Book Title, Author, Narrator, Series Name, Series #, Year
